creator: krumpo@pobox.sk

text:
reverse mapping for Cp12?? encodings are invalid, should be in upper case
(see my original patch)
creator: krumpo@pobox.sk
neilg@ca.ibm.com
text:
Can you give a reason why the reverse hash should return CP and not Cp?  Cp* 
aren't IANA names, and according to the documentation I can find on Java 
encoding names, mixed case is what's recognized.  Seems to me that the reverse 
hash should key on the precise values of the encoding hash.
